intro: Weinmannia organensis, commonly known as the Galápagos weinmannia, is a flowering plant native to the Galápagos Islands. It belongs to the family Cupressaceae, which includes cypress and juniper species. The plant is characterized by its dense, evergreen foliage and distinctive, narrow, needle-like leaves. It typically grows in coastal areas and is adapted to the arid climate of the islands. Weinmannia organensis plays an important ecological role in the unique ecosystems of the Galápagos.
